intro: Erigeron moupinensis, commonly known as the Moupin fleur-de-lis, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features delicate, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem.
